jim's trucking

Of course they move. How else could one observe laminated sedimentary stone (wherein layers that were level when formed) are now piled upon each other at extreme angles. Take a drive through the mountains...you'll see what I mean. The angled layers were once level (to the extent that the curved surface of the earth is considered locally level).
 
 Whether they move (or have moved) is a rhetorical question.emoticon_xbye
